--- ## QCD in the Continuum
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[ F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]+\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big) \psi_f$$
## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in-ease-out" auto-animate-duration=1}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =\textcolor{#EB811B}{-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]} +\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f$$
:::: {.columns } ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge fields**:
$$\normalsize A_\mu(x) = \sum_{a=1}^8 A_\mu^a(x)\, T^a$$
- $\small \left[ T_a,T_b\right]= i f_{abc}T_c$ and $\small \left\{ T_a,T_b\right\}= \frac 1 2 \delta_{ab}$ - $\small A_\mu(x)$ encapsulates the 8 gluons - $\small A_\mu^a(x)\in \mathfrak{su}(3)$. ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - **Field strength tensor**:
$$ F_{\mu\nu} = \partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu - i g \,[A_\mu, A_\nu] $$
::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} A_\mu & \longrightarrow & UA_\mu U^\dagger \\ F_{\mu\nu} & \longrightarrow & U\,F_{\mu\nu}\,U^\dagger \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Covariance**: - $\small F_{\mu\nu}$ transforms *homogeneously* - $\small \mathrm{Tr}[F_{\mu\nu}F^{\mu\nu}]$ is **gauge invariant** ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:1.0em; font-style:italic; color:gray; margin-top:-20px; margin-right:0px; text-align:right;"} **[Pure gauge]{style="color: #EB811B;"} â†’ already highly non-trivial:** confinement, glueballs, non-linear self-interactions... ::: ## QCD in the Continuum
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} = -\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right] +\textcolor{#EB811B}{\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f}$$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Quark fields**: - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → flavor $\small f=1,\dots,N_f$ - Real world → $\small N_f = 6$ - Fundamental rep. of $\small \mathrm{SU}(3)_C$ - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → $\small (\textcolor{red}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{green}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{blue}{\psi_f(x)})$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" } - **Covariant derivative**: $$D_\mu = \partial_\mu - i g A_\mu$$ - Couples quarks to gluons - Ensures **local gauge invariance** ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,\psi_f \\ \bar{\psi}_f & \longrightarrow & \bar{\psi}_f\,U^\dagger \\ D_\mu \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,D_\mu \psi_f \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Facts**: Quarks are never observed as free particles - Combined into **color singlets** â†’ hadrons - mesons ( $\small \pi^{\pm}, \pi^0\dots$) - baryons ( $\small p,n\dots$) ::: ::: :::: ## Interactions in QCD ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1"} **Gauge invariance** not only dictates the kinetic terms, but also **fixes the interaction structure**: ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:10px; margin-left:120px; justify-content:center; font-size:1.3em; font-weight:200;"} $\small \sim g \bar{\psi}\psi A$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3" style="margin-top:-54px; margin-left:550px; justify-content:center; font-size:1.3em; font-weight:200;"} $\small \sim g \partial A A A \quad \quad \quad \sim g^2 AAAA$ ::: :::{.r-hstack style="align-items:center; justify-content:center; margin-top:-10px;"} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-35px;"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2"} - **QED-like vertex** - quarkâ€“gluon interaction - analogous to electronâ€“photon in QED ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-35px;"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="4"} - **New in QCD** - 3-gluon and 4-gluon self-interactions - consequence of non-abelian $\mathrm{SU}(3)_C$ - lead to confinement, asymptotic freedom, glueballs... ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:left;"} Quantum corrections lead to divergencies: Interactions are treated in the **renormalization framework** â†’ [**running**]{style="color: #EB811B;"} of the coupling $g(\mu)$. ::: :::{.r-hstack style="align-items:center; justify-content:center; margin-top:300px"} ::: ## Running of the Coupling :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="45%"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Scale dependent** coupling: $\small g \,\longrightarrow\, g(\mu)$ ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - Governed by the **Î²-function**: $$\small \mu \frac{dg}{d\mu} = \beta(g), \quad \beta(g) = -\beta_0 \frac{g^3}{16\pi^2} + \mathcal{O}(g^5) $$ with $\small \;\beta_0 = 11 - \tfrac{2}{3} N_f$ ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - **Solution at 1-loop**: $$\small \alpha_s(\mu) \equiv \frac{g^2(\mu)}{4\pi} = \frac{1}{\beta_0 \ln(\mu^2 / \Lambda_{\text{QCD}}^2)} $$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"}
::: :::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-60px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Consequences**: - $\small \mu \to \infty \;\;\Rightarrow\;\; \alpha_s(\mu) \to 0 \;\Rightarrow\; \color{#EB811B}\text{asymptotic freedom}$ - $\small \mu \to \Lambda_{\text{QCD}} \;\;\Rightarrow\;\; \alpha_s(\mu) \to \infty \;\Rightarrow\; \color{#EB811B}\text{confinement}$ ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:10px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:right;"} QCD becomes strongly coupled in the IR â†’ [**non-perturbative tools**]{style="color: #EB811B;"} are required! ::: ## Confinement ::: {class="fragment"} - At low energies $\small \alpha_s(\mu) \gg 1$ ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **QCD potential**:
$$\small V(r) = -\,\frac{4}{3}\frac{\alpha_s}{r} + \sigma r \quad \quad \quad \;\sigma \approx 0.9\ \mathrm{GeV/fm} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px;"} - **Force**:
$$ \small |dV/dr|_{\mathrm{QCD}} \approx 0.9 \times 1.6\cdot10^{-10} \text{J}/10^{-15}\ \text{m} \approx 1.6\cdot10^{4}\ \text{N} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-40px; margin-left:25px;"}
$\small |dV/dr|_{\mathrm{QED}} \approx 2.3 \cdot 10^{2} \ \mathrm{N}$
::: ::: {class="fragment fade-in-then-semi-out" style="position:absolute; left:-40px; top:308px;"} ::: ::: {.callout type='default' class="fragment" style="margin-top:130px; width:fit-content; margin-left:20px; margin-right:20px; margin-bottom:50px;"} ## Particle Data Group ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: :::: ## QCD at Low Energies :::: {.columns} ::: {.column style="margin-top:40px; width:65%;" } ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:80px;} - For $\mu \sim \Lambda_{\text{QCD}}$: - $\alpha_s(\mu)$ is large - Perturbation theory breaks down ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2"} - Physics is dominated by **non-perturbative phenomena**: - Confinement - Mass gap - Hadron spectrum & structure ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3"} - Need **non-perturbative tools**: - **Lattice QCD** (first-principles numerical approach) - **Effective Field Theories** (low-energy approximations) ::: ::: ::: {.column width="35%"} ::: :::: ## Lattice QCD :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="65%"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Euclidean formulation**: Discretize space-time as a **4D grid** ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - Introduces two natural **cutoffs**: - **UV** : lattice spacing $a$ - **IR** : finite volume $L^4$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Fields on the lattice**: - Quarks: $\;\psi(x) \;\;\to\;\; a^{-3/2}\psi(n)$ (sites) - Gauge fields: $\;A_\mu(x) \;\;\to\;\; U_\mu(n) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$ (links) ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - Gauge links act as **parallel transporters** ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Boundary conditions**: - Periodic (PBC) for gauge fields - Anti-periodic (APBC) for fermions ::: ::: ::: {.column width="35%"}
::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px; margin-left:400px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:right;"} QCD becomes a set of **dimensionless variables**
It can be solved numerically using **[Monte Carlo techniques]{style="color: #EB811B;"}** ::: ## Monte Carlo methods
$$ \langle \mathcal{O}\rangle = \frac{1}{Z}\int [dU]\textcolor{blue}{[d\bar\psi d\psi]}\,\mathcal{O}\, e^{-S_G[U]-\textcolor{blue}{\bar\psi} D[U]\textcolor{blue}{\psi}} = \frac{1}{Z}\int [dU]\,\mathcal{O}_F[U]\,\textcolor{blue}{\det D[U]}\,e^{-S_G[U]} $$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px; margin-bottom:-30px;"} 1. **Importance sampling** Draw gauge configurations $\small \left\{ U_\mu^{(i)} \right\}$ from:
$$ \mathcal{P}[U]\propto e^{-S_G[U]}\,\det D[U] $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px;"} 2. $\small \forall i$ compute **fermionic observable** $\langle\mathcal{O}\rangle_F[U^{(i)}]$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px; margin-bottom:-20px;"} 3. Ensemble average (**estimator**)
$$ \overline{\mathcal{O}} \;=\; \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \langle\mathcal{O}\rangle_F[U^{(i)}] \;=\; \langle\mathcal{O}\rangle \;+\; \delta\mathcal{O} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-30px;"} 4. Set the **physical scale** $\small a$ (e.g. hadron masses) ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px;"} 5. **Continuum / infinite-volume limits**:
- Remove the **UV** ($\small a \to 0$) and **IR** ($\small L \to \infty$) cut-off - (if needed) **chiral extrapolation** $\small m_q\to m_q^{\rm phys}$
::: ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ::: {.fragment style="margin-top:60px;"} | Experiments | Lattice QCD | |------------|------------| | Accelerators (LHC) | Ensemble of configurations | | Detectors (CMS, ATLAS) | Fermionic observables | ::: ::: :::: ## Why we need strong machines?
$$ \text{Computational cost} \sim c \;\times\; (\# \text{confs}) \;\times\; \left(\frac{1}{M_\pi}\right)^6 \;\times\; L^5 \;\times\; (a^{-1})^7 $$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.fragment style="margin-top:-20px;"} - Cost grows rapidly when approaching: - **physical pion masses** - **large volumes** - **fine lattice spacing** ::: ::: {.fragment} - At the **physical point** with $L=32$: - Generating $3\times 10^3$
â†’ **$2\times 10^6$ core hours** configurations - Without parallelization on a stand-alone PC
â†’ **~230 years** ::: ::: {.fragment} - Data per configuration: $\mathcal{O}(1\text{-}50)$ GB â†’ **Tera/Petabytes of data** generated ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.fragment} **HPC** resources provide: 1. Hundreds of nodes with CPUs/GPUs 2. High memory per node 3. High network bandwidth ::: ::: :::: ## Chiral Limit in QCD {auto-animate=true} ::: {class="fragment"} **Chiral Transformations**:
$$\psi \;\longrightarrow\; e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}\, \psi;\quad \quad \bar{\psi} \;\longrightarrow\; \bar{\psi}\, e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}$$
in the $\small m_f \to 0$ is a symmetry of the Lagrangian ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Left / Right modes**: $$ \psi_L = P_L \psi, \quad \psi_R = P_R \psi $$ with $P_{L,R} = \frac{1\mp\gamma_5}{2}$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-24px;"} - $$ \bar{\psi}\, i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} $$
â†’ does **not mix** chirality
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-30px;" } - $$ \,\bar{\psi}m\psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} m \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} m \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} $$
â†’ explicitly **couples** $\textcolor{red}{\small L}$ and $\textcolor{blue}{\small R}$

--- ## QCD in the Continuum
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[ F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]+\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big) \psi_f$$
## QCD in the Continuum {auto-animate=true auto-animate-easing="ease-in-ease-out" auto-animate-duration=1}
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} =\textcolor{#EB811B}{-\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right]} +\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f$$
:::: {.columns } ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge fields**:
$$\normalsize A_\mu(x) = \sum_{a=1}^8 A_\mu^a(x)\, T^a$$
- $\small \left[ T_a,T_b\right]= i f_{abc}T_c$ and $\small \left\{ T_a,T_b\right\}= \frac 1 2 \delta_{ab}$ - $\small A_\mu(x)$ encapsulates the 8 gluons - $\small A_\mu^a(x)\in \mathfrak{su}(3)$. ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - **Field strength tensor**:
$$ F_{\mu\nu} = \partial_\mu A_\nu - \partial_\nu A_\mu - i g \,[A_\mu, A_\nu] $$
::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} A_\mu & \longrightarrow & UA_\mu U^\dagger \\ F_{\mu\nu} & \longrightarrow & U\,F_{\mu\nu}\,U^\dagger \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Covariance**: - $\small F_{\mu\nu}$ transforms *homogeneously* - $\small \mathrm{Tr}[F_{\mu\nu}F^{\mu\nu}]$ is **gauge invariant** ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="font-size:1.0em; font-style:italic; color:gray; margin-top:-20px; margin-right:0px; text-align:right;"} **[Pure gauge]{style="color: #EB811B;"} â†’ already highly non-trivial:** confinement, glueballs, non-linear self-interactions... ::: ## QCD in the Continuum
$$\mathcal{L}_{\mathrm{QCD}} = -\tfrac{1}{2}\mathrm{Tr}\left[F_{\mu\nu} F^{\mu\nu}\right] +\textcolor{#EB811B}{\sum_{f=1}^{N_f} \bar{\psi}_f \big( i \gamma^\mu D_\mu - m_f \big)\psi_f}$$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Quark fields**: - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → flavor $\small f=1,\dots,N_f$ - Real world → $\small N_f = 6$ - Fundamental rep. of $\small \mathrm{SU}(3)_C$ - $\small \psi_f(x)$ → $\small (\textcolor{red}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{green}{\psi_f(x)}, \textcolor{blue}{\psi_f(x)})$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" } - **Covariant derivative**: $$D_\mu = \partial_\mu - i g A_\mu$$ - Couples quarks to gluons - Ensures **local gauge invariance** ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Gauge transformations**: $\small \forall\; U(x) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$
$$ \begin{array}{rcl} \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,\psi_f \\ \bar{\psi}_f & \longrightarrow & \bar{\psi}_f\,U^\dagger \\ D_\mu \psi_f & \longrightarrow & U\,D_\mu \psi_f \end{array} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-27px"} - **Facts**: Quarks are never observed as free particles - Combined into **color singlets** â†’ hadrons - mesons ( $\small \pi^{\pm}, \pi^0\dots$) - baryons ( $\small p,n\dots$) ::: ::: :::: ## Interactions in QCD ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1"} **Gauge invariance** not only dictates the kinetic terms, but also **fixes the interaction structure**: ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:10px; margin-left:120px; justify-content:center; font-size:1.3em; font-weight:200;"} $\small \sim g \bar{\psi}\psi A$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3" style="margin-top:-54px; margin-left:550px; justify-content:center; font-size:1.3em; font-weight:200;"} $\small \sim g \partial A A A \quad \quad \quad \sim g^2 AAAA$ ::: :::{.r-hstack style="align-items:center; justify-content:center; margin-top:-10px;"} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-35px;"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2"} - **QED-like vertex** - quarkâ€“gluon interaction - analogous to electronâ€“photon in QED ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-35px;"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="4"} - **New in QCD** - 3-gluon and 4-gluon self-interactions - consequence of non-abelian $\mathrm{SU}(3)_C$ - lead to confinement, asymptotic freedom, glueballs... ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:left;"} Quantum corrections lead to divergencies: Interactions are treated in the **renormalization framework** â†’ [**running**]{style="color: #EB811B;"} of the coupling $g(\mu)$. ::: :::{.r-hstack style="align-items:center; justify-content:center; margin-top:300px"} ::: ## Running of the Coupling :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="45%"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Scale dependent** coupling: $\small g \,\longrightarrow\, g(\mu)$ ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - Governed by the **Î²-function**: $$\small \mu \frac{dg}{d\mu} = \beta(g), \quad \beta(g) = -\beta_0 \frac{g^3}{16\pi^2} + \mathcal{O}(g^5) $$ with $\small \;\beta_0 = 11 - \tfrac{2}{3} N_f$ ::: ::: {class="fragment"} - **Solution at 1-loop**: $$\small \alpha_s(\mu) \equiv \frac{g^2(\mu)}{4\pi} = \frac{1}{\beta_0 \ln(\mu^2 / \Lambda_{\text{QCD}}^2)} $$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"}
::: :::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:-60px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Consequences**: - $\small \mu \to \infty \;\;\Rightarrow\;\; \alpha_s(\mu) \to 0 \;\Rightarrow\; \color{#EB811B}\text{asymptotic freedom}$ - $\small \mu \to \Lambda_{\text{QCD}} \;\;\Rightarrow\;\; \alpha_s(\mu) \to \infty \;\Rightarrow\; \color{#EB811B}\text{confinement}$ ::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:10px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:right;"} QCD becomes strongly coupled in the IR â†’ [**non-perturbative tools**]{style="color: #EB811B;"} are required! ::: ## Confinement ::: {class="fragment"} - At low energies $\small \alpha_s(\mu) \gg 1$ ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **QCD potential**:
$$\small V(r) = -\,\frac{4}{3}\frac{\alpha_s}{r} + \sigma r \quad \quad \quad \;\sigma \approx 0.9\ \mathrm{GeV/fm} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px;"} - **Force**:
$$ \small |dV/dr|_{\mathrm{QCD}} \approx 0.9 \times 1.6\cdot10^{-10} \text{J}/10^{-15}\ \text{m} \approx 1.6\cdot10^{4}\ \text{N} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-40px; margin-left:25px;"}
$\small |dV/dr|_{\mathrm{QED}} \approx 2.3 \cdot 10^{2} \ \mathrm{N}$
::: ::: {class="fragment fade-in-then-semi-out" style="position:absolute; left:-40px; top:308px;"} ::: ::: {.callout type='default' class="fragment" style="margin-top:130px; width:fit-content; margin-left:20px; margin-right:20px; margin-bottom:50px;"} ## Particle Data Group ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: :::: ## QCD at Low Energies :::: {.columns} ::: {.column style="margin-top:40px; width:65%;" } ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:80px;} - For $\mu \sim \Lambda_{\text{QCD}}$: - $\alpha_s(\mu)$ is large - Perturbation theory breaks down ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2"} - Physics is dominated by **non-perturbative phenomena**: - Confinement - Mass gap - Hadron spectrum & structure ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3"} - Need **non-perturbative tools**: - **Lattice QCD** (first-principles numerical approach) - **Effective Field Theories** (low-energy approximations) ::: ::: ::: {.column width="35%"} ::: :::: ## Lattice QCD :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="65%"} ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="1" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Euclidean formulation**: Discretize space-time as a **4D grid** ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="2" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - Introduces two natural **cutoffs**: - **UV** : lattice spacing $a$ - **IR** : finite volume $L^4$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" data-fragment-index="3" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Fields on the lattice**: - Quarks: $\;\psi(x) \;\;\to\;\; a^{-3/2}\psi(n)$ (sites) - Gauge fields: $\;A_\mu(x) \;\;\to\;\; U_\mu(n) \in \mathrm{SU}(3)$ (links) ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - Gauge links act as **parallel transporters** ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-8px;"} - **Boundary conditions**: - Periodic (PBC) for gauge fields - Anti-periodic (APBC) for fermions ::: ::: ::: {.column width="35%"}
::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px; margin-left:400px; font-style:italic; color:gray; text-align:right;"} QCD becomes a set of **dimensionless variables**
It can be solved numerically using **[Monte Carlo techniques]{style="color: #EB811B;"}** ::: ## Monte Carlo methods
$$ \langle \mathcal{O}\rangle = \frac{1}{Z}\int [dU]\textcolor{blue}{[d\bar\psi d\psi]}\,\mathcal{O}\, e^{-S_G[U]-\textcolor{blue}{\bar\psi} D[U]\textcolor{blue}{\psi}} = \frac{1}{Z}\int [dU]\,\mathcal{O}_F[U]\,\textcolor{blue}{\det D[U]}\,e^{-S_G[U]} $$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="70%"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px; margin-bottom:-30px;"} 1. **Importance sampling** Draw gauge configurations $\small \left\{ U_\mu^{(i)} \right\}$ from:
$$ \mathcal{P}[U]\propto e^{-S_G[U]}\,\det D[U] $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px;"} 2. $\small \forall i$ compute **fermionic observable** $\langle\mathcal{O}\rangle_F[U^{(i)}]$ ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px; margin-bottom:-20px;"} 3. Ensemble average (**estimator**)
$$ \overline{\mathcal{O}} \;=\; \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \langle\mathcal{O}\rangle_F[U^{(i)}] \;=\; \langle\mathcal{O}\rangle \;+\; \delta\mathcal{O} $$
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-30px;"} 4. Set the **physical scale** $\small a$ (e.g. hadron masses) ::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-10px;"} 5. **Continuum / infinite-volume limits**:
- Remove the **UV** ($\small a \to 0$) and **IR** ($\small L \to \infty$) cut-off - (if needed) **chiral extrapolation** $\small m_q\to m_q^{\rm phys}$
::: ::: ::: {.column width="30%"} ::: {.fragment style="margin-top:60px;"} | Experiments | Lattice QCD | |------------|------------| | Accelerators (LHC) | Ensemble of configurations | | Detectors (CMS, ATLAS) | Fermionic observables | ::: ::: :::: ## Why we need strong machines?
$$ \text{Computational cost} \sim c \;\times\; (\# \text{confs}) \;\times\; \left(\frac{1}{M_\pi}\right)^6 \;\times\; L^5 \;\times\; (a^{-1})^7 $$
:::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {.fragment style="margin-top:-20px;"} - Cost grows rapidly when approaching: - **physical pion masses** - **large volumes** - **fine lattice spacing** ::: ::: {.fragment} - At the **physical point** with $L=32$: - Generating $3\times 10^3$
â†’ **$2\times 10^6$ core hours** configurations - Without parallelization on a stand-alone PC
â†’ **~230 years** ::: ::: {.fragment} - Data per configuration: $\mathcal{O}(1\text{-}50)$ GB â†’ **Tera/Petabytes of data** generated ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.fragment} **HPC** resources provide: 1. Hundreds of nodes with CPUs/GPUs 2. High memory per node 3. High network bandwidth ::: ::: :::: ## Chiral Limit in QCD {auto-animate=true} ::: {class="fragment"} **Chiral Transformations**:
$$\psi \;\longrightarrow\; e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}\, \psi;\quad \quad \bar{\psi} \;\longrightarrow\; \bar{\psi}\, e^{\,i \alpha \gamma_5/2}$$
in the $\small m_f \to 0$ is a symmetry of the Lagrangian ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment"} - **Left / Right modes**: $$ \psi_L = P_L \psi, \quad \psi_R = P_R \psi $$ with $P_{L,R} = \frac{1\mp\gamma_5}{2}$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:0px;"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-24px;"} - $$ \bar{\psi}\, i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} i\gamma^\mu D_\mu \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} $$
â†’ does **not mix** chirality
::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-30px;" } - $$ \,\bar{\psi}m\psi = \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{red}{\small L} m \psi_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} + \bar{\psi}_\textcolor{blue}{\small R} m \psi_\textcolor{red}{\small L} $$
â†’ explicitly **couples** $\textcolor{red}{\small L}$ and $\textcolor{blue}{\small R}$
::: ::: :::: ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:20px;"} - **Chiral limit**: $\small m_u = m_d = 0$ ⇒ $\small \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{SU}(2)_A \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V$ is a **global symmetry**: - QCD spectrum **does not show parity doubling**. ::: ## Chiral symmetry breaking in real QCD :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:30px;"} ::: {class="fragment" style="margin-top:-20px;"} 1. **Spontaneous breaking** - $\small \langle \bar{\psi}\psi \rangle \neq 0$ (non-trivial QCD vacuum) - $\small \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{SU}(2)_A \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V \;\;\longrightarrow\;\; \mathrm{SU}(2)_V \times \mathrm{U}(1)_V$ - 3 Nambuâ€“Goldstone bosons ⇒ the **pions** 2. **Explicit breaking** - light quark masses $\small m_{u,d} \neq 0$ - GMOR: $\small{ M_{\pi}^2 = (m_u + m_d)}\frac{\large \langle \bar{\psi}\psi \rangle}{\large f_{\pi}^2} \simeq 135 \mathrm{\, MeV}$ ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%" style="margin-top:20px;"} ::: ::::
